title: "Bad behavior"
body:
Just want to know why people don't use the **ignore feature**? - If somebody says something you don't like, press ignore... Why does it all lead to a massive argument, and pointless reports? and mutes? 

Its very easy to just press ignore after one toxic comment, why egg it on and feed intentionally just to make them mad, and report it? is half of the community really that weak?

Id very much prefer the "**Abusive**" player doing well, over the person causing the problems my running in to die every 2 minutes or just going afk/feeding ... but the feeder has nothing done about it, but the player that was annoyed about it cops a report from the feeder then gets a mute? 

Of course if you join a ranked game, say "**Im new just want to learn this champ, dont get angry if i feed all game**" and you then feed all game, of course people will be annoyed, there are other game modes to "Learn in" 

If you dont think you could achieve atleast a gold rating, why do you join ranked at all? 
 _**Practice in normal**_, till you think you have what it takes to climb.

Do any of you nerds ever leave your basement? Some people are dicks, learn to deal with it. I was leaving a cricket ground recently and someone called me a "posh twat". Did I go and find the police and make a complaint? Did I turn around and call him a peasant? No, I did what any normal human being does when they're being addressed by someone they do not wish to engage and ignored him. In League of Legends you even have a function that enables you to completely remove the offensive player's ability to communicate with you. Imagine that, if a drunk guy in a bar is being obnoxious you can just press a button and he turns into a hat stand, leaving you to go about your business unhindered. The issue isn't that the LoL community is more "toxic" than others, it's that LoL players are a bunch of softcock hypocrites who seemingly can't find the mute button and can't deal with random people on the internet saying mean things despite, in most cases, dishing out their own fair share of abuse.
